links.title: Met Office Global Deterministic Near Surface
Met Office Global Deterministic Near Surface

fog_fraction_at_screen_level.title: Fog fraction at screen level
fog_fraction_at_screen_level.description: Here fog means a visibility of 1000 m or lower. The reduction in visibility is caused water droplets or minute ice crystals forming close to the surface. This quantity represents the fraction of horizontal grid square occupied by fog. An alternative interpretation is that this represents the fractional probability of fog being present at any location in the grid square.

latent_heat_flux_at_surface_mean-PT01H.title: Hourly latent heat flux at surface mean
latent_heat_flux_at_surface_mean-PT01H.description: The latent heat flux, averaged over a model time step, at the surface.

precipitation_accumulation-PT01H.title: Hourly precipitation accumulation
precipitation_accumulation-PT01H.description: Implied depth of the layer of liquid water which has been deposited on the surface in the previous hour. This includes rain, snow and hail, with the ice phase precipitation being considered as a liquid water equivalent (LWE) value. It includes the contribution from the model convection scheme if this is invoked.

precipitation_rate.title: Precipitation rate
precipitation_rate.description: Instantaneous rate at which liquid water (as a depth) was being deposited on the surface. This includes rain, snow and hail with the ice phase precipitation being considered as a liquid water equivalent (LWE) value. It includes the contribution from the model convection scheme if this is invoked.

pressure_at_mean_sea_level.title: Pressure at mean sea level
pressure_at_mean_sea_level.description: Air pressure at mean sea level which is close to the geoid in sea areas. Air pressure at sea level is the quantity often abbreviated as MSLP or PMSL.

radiation_flux_in_longwave_downward_at_s.title: Radiation flux in longwave downward at surface
radiation_flux_in_longwave_downward_at_s.description: Longwave radiation at the surface from above directed at the ground.

radiation_flux_in_shortwave_direct_downw.title: Radiation flux in shortwave direct downward at surface
radiation_flux_in_shortwave_direct_downw.description: Direct component of shortwave radiation at the surface from above directed at the ground.

radiation_flux_in_shortwave_total_downwa.title: Radiation flux in shortwave total downward at surface
radiation_flux_in_shortwave_total_downwa.description: Total shortwave radiation at the surface from above directed at the ground.

radiation_flux_in_uv_downward_at_surface.title: Radiation flux in uv downward at surface
radiation_flux_in_uv_downward_at_surface.description: Ultaviolet radiation at the surface from above directed at the ground.

rainfall_accumulation-PT01H.title: Hourly rainfall accumulation
rainfall_accumulation-PT01H.description: Implied depth of the rain produced by the model precipitation scheme which has been deposited on the surface in the previous hour. This excludes the rain produced by the model convection scheme.

rainfall_rate.title: Rainfall rate
rainfall_rate.description: Instantaneous rate at which rain (as a depth) was being produced by the model precipitation scheme and deposited on the surface. This excludes the rain produced by the model convection scheme.

rainfall_rate_from_convection.title: Rainfall rate from convection
rainfall_rate_from_convection.description: Instantaneous rate at which rain (as a depth) was produced by the model convection scheme and deposited on the surface. The rainfall rate can be added to this to get the total rainfall rate.

rainfall_rate_from_convection_max-PT01H.title: Hourly rainfall rate from convection max
rainfall_rate_from_convection_max-PT01H.description: Maximum instantaneous rate at which rain (as a depth) has been produced by the model convection scheme and deposited on the surface in the previous hour.

relative_humidity_at_screen_level.title: Relative humidity at screen level
relative_humidity_at_screen_level.description: Fractional relative humidity (ratio of the partial pressure of water vapour to the equilibrium vapour pressure of water) at screen level (1.5m above the surface.)

snow_depth_water_equivalent.title: Snow depth water equivalent
snow_depth_water_equivalent.description: Liquid water equivalent (LWE) depth of the snow lying on the surface (ground). Typically water is 10 times as dense as snow, so multiplying by 10 gives an approximate depth of the snow, although wet snow can be significantly denser and powder snow much less dense.

snowfall_rate.title: Snowfall rate
snowfall_rate.description: Instantaneous rate at which liquid water equivalent (LWE) snow (as a depth) was produced by the model precipitation scheme and deposited on the surface. This excludes the snow produced by the the model convection scheme.

snowfall_rate_from_convection.title: Snowfall rate from convection
snowfall_rate_from_convection.description: Instantaneous rate at which liquid water equivalent (LWE) snow (as a depth) has been produced by the model convection scheme and deposited on the surface. The snowfall rate can be added to this to get the total snowfall rate.

snowfall_rate_from_convection_max-PT01H.title: Hourly snowfall rate from convection max
snowfall_rate_from_convection_max-PT01H.description: Maximum instantaneous rate at which liquid water equivalent (LWE) snow (as a depth) has been produced by the model convection scheme and deposited on the surface in the previous hour.

snowfall_rate_from_convection_mean-PT01H.title: Hourly snowfall rate from convection mean
snowfall_rate_from_convection_mean-PT01H.description: Mean rate at which liquid water equivalent (LWE) snow (as a depth) has been produced by the model convection scheme and deposited on the surface in the previous hour.

temperature_at_screen_level.title: Temperature at screen level
temperature_at_screen_level.description: Instantaneous air temperature at screen level (1.5m).

temperature_at_screen_level_max-PT01H.title: Hourly temperature at screen level max
temperature_at_screen_level_max-PT01H.description: Maximum instantaneous air temperature at screen level (1.5m) in the previous hour.

temperature_at_screen_level_min-PT01H.title: Hourly temperature at screen level min
temperature_at_screen_level_min-PT01H.description: Minimum instantaneous air temperature at screen level (1.5m) in the previous hour.

temperature_at_surface.title: Temperature at surface
temperature_at_surface.description: Temperature at the surface interface between the air and the ground.

temperature_of_dew_point_at_screen_level.title: Dew point temperature at screen level
temperature_of_dew_point_at_screen_level.description: Instantaneous dew point temperature (temperature at which a parcel of air reaches saturation upon being cooled at constant pressure and specific humidity) at screen level (1.5m).

visibility_at_screen_level.title: Visibility at screen level
visibility_at_screen_level.description: Horizontal distance at which something can be seen horizontally from screen level (1.5m).

wind_direction_at_10m.title: Wind direction at 10m
wind_direction_at_10m.description: Wind at 10m above the surface is defined as a two-dimensional (horizontal) air velocity vector with no vertical component. In meteorological reports the direction of the wind vector is given as the direction from which it is blowing. Note: This with wind speed at 10m replaces x wind at 10m and y wind at 10m.

wind_gust_at_10m.title: Wind gust at 10m
wind_gust_at_10m.description: Diagnosed instantaneous wind gust at 10m. This can be considered as the extreme rather than steady wind speed that might be experienced at this specific time.

wind_gust_at_10m_max-PT01H.title: Hourly wind gust at 10m max
wind_gust_at_10m_max-PT01H.description: Maximum diagnosed instantaneous wind gust at 10m in the previous hour. This can be considered as the extreme wind speed that might be experienced in this period.

wind_speed_at_10m.title: Wind speed at 10m
wind_speed_at_10m.description: Wind at 10m above the surface is defined as a two-dimensional (horizontal) air velocity vector with no vertical component. The speed is the magnitude of velocity.
